citations.narrative:
The facility is not following the guidance in their written Program of Veterinary Care. The following protocols are
documented in the Program of Veterinary Care, but are not being provided to the dogs:
* Heartworm preventative is to be provided monthly.
* Pregnant females are to receive a dosage of Ivermectin pour-on at 50 days of
pregnancy.
* At 4 days of age, puppies are to receive a dosage of Marquis and then every 10 days
afterwards.
* At 5 days of age, the puppies are to be dewormed with Safeguard, but the licensee is
waiting until the puppies are 7 days old.
* At 3 weeks of age, puppies are to receive a dosage of Ivermectin pour-on and repeat
every 14 days afterward.
* Flea treatment is to be provided every 2 weeks during flea months, but the licensee is
providing the treatment only once a month.
Failure to follow the guidance documented in the Program of Veterinary Care does not ensure the dogs are receiving
adequate veterinary care which could have a negative impact on their health and well-being.
Each dealer must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care. The licensee must follow all the protocols and
guidance documented in their Program of Veterinary Care in order to protect and support the health and well-being of the
dogs.
To be corrected by: 14-June-2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the guidance in their written Program of Veterinary Care.  The following protocols are 
documented in the Program of Veterinary Care, but are not being provided to the dogs: 
 
*  Heartworm preventative is to be provided monthly. 
*  Pregnant females are to receive a dosage of Ivermectin pour-on at 50 days of  
   pregnancy. 
*  At 4 days of age, puppies are to receive a dosage of Marquis and then every 10 days  
   afterwards. 
*  At 5 days of age, the puppies are to be dewormed with Safeguard, but the licensee is 
   waiting until the puppies are 7 days old. 
*  At 3 weeks of age, puppies are to receive a dosage of Ivermectin pour-on and repeat  
    every 14 days afterward. 
*  Flea treatment is to be provided every 2 weeks during flea months, but the licensee is  
    providing the treatment only once a month.

Failure to follow the guidance documented in the Program of Veterinary Care does not ensure the dogs are receiving 
adequate veterinary care which could have a negative impact on their health and well-being. 
 
Each dealer must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care.  The licensee must follow all the protocols and 
guidance documented in their Program of Veterinary Care in order to protect and support the health and well-being of the 
dogs. 
 
To be corrected by:  14-June-2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
